name: Venusaur & Snivy-GX
text: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Solar Blast GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent’s Pokemon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) If this Pokemon has at least 2 additional Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack’s cost), heal all damage from each of your Pokemon. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

ability.name: Shining Vine
ability.text: If this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, whenever you attach a [G] Energy from your hand to this Pokemon during your turn, you may choose 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokemon and switch it with their Active Pokemon.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokemon between turns.

attacks.name: Grass Knot
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each [C] in the Retreat Cost of your opponent’s Active Pokemon.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Great Horn
attacks.text: If your opponent has any TAG TEAM Pokemon in play, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a [G] Energy and attach it to 1 of your Pokemon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Leaf Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokemon.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

ability.name: Season’s Blessings
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw 1 card.

name: Charizard & Braixen-GX
text: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shiny Flare
attacks.text: You may search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Crimson Flame Pillar GX
attacks.text: Attach 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokemon in any way you like. If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack’s cost), your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Burned and Confused. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokemon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attacks.name: Rally Back
attacks.text: If any of your Pokemon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent’s last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

ability.name: Victory Heal
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

ability.name: Steam Dance
ability.text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may look at the top 8 cards of your deck and attach any basic Energy you find there to your Pokemon in any way you like. Then, shuffle the remaining cards into your deck.

name: Blastoise & Piplup-GX
text: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Splash Maker
attacks.text: You may attach up to 3 [W] Energy from your hand to your Pokemon in any way you like. Then, heal 50 damage from each of those Pokemon for each Energy you attached to them.

attacks.name: Bubble Launcher GX
attacks.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If this Pokemon has at least 3 additional [W] Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack’s cost), this attack does 150 more damage. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Confusion Wave
attacks.text: Both Active Pokemon are now Confused.

attacks.name: Energy Loop
attacks.text: Return 1 Energy from this Pokemon to your hand.

attacks.name: High Tide
attacks.text: Attach 2 [W] Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokemon.

attacks.name: Swirling Waves
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon.

ability.name: Whirlpool Drag
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokemon is on your Bench, you may have your opponent switch their Active Pokemon with 1 of their Benched Pokemon. If you do, discard all cards attached to this Pokemon and put this Pokemon at the bottom of your deck.

attacks.name: Ominous Eyes
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counter on 1 of your opponent’s Pokemon.

ability.name: Soul Evolution
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 3 cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokemon and put it onto this Pokemon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Disable
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent’s Active Pokemon’s attacks. That Pokemon can’t use that attack during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Psych Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokemon’s Psych Up attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

ability.name: Fainting Stamp
ability.text: If this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent’s attack, put 4 damage counters on your opponent’s Pokemon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Cycle Draw
attacks.text: Discard 1 card from your hand. Then, draw 2 cards from your deck.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy from your discard pile to your Benched Pokemon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Deceiving Forest
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch their Active Pokemon with 1 of their Benched Pokemon.

attacks.name: Shadow Impact
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on 1 of your Pokemon.

attacks.name: Seaweed Gathering
attacks.text: Put 1 Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Buster Swing
attacks.text: This attack’s damage isn’t affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Shadow Mimic
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent’s Active Pokemon’s attacks (excluding a GX attack) and use it as this attack.

attacks.name: Depth Bomb
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent’s Pokémon in any way you like. If your opponent has exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, put 12 damage counters on them instead.

attacks.name: Drought
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 basic [F] Energy cards from your hand and attach them to 1 of your Pokemon.

attacks.name: Shaking Earth
attacks.text: This Pokemon can’t use this attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Counter Throw
attacks.text: This attack does 90 more damage if any of your Benched Pokemon have damage counters on them.

attacks.name: Frozen Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 80 more damage if this Pokemon has any [W] Energy attached to it.

ability.name: Hard Shell
ability.text: This Pokemon takes 30 less damage from attacks.

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 energy attached to your opponent’s Active Pokemon.

name: Alolan Persian-GX
text: When your Pokemon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Stalking Claw GX
attacks.text: This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Pokemon. Don’t apply Weakness, Resistance, and any other effects on that Pokemon. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

ability.name: Smug Face
ability.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon by your opponent’s Tag Team Pokemon, Ultra Beasts, and Pokemon with Special Energy attached to them.

attacks.name: Nasty Goo
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Panic Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Poisoned, Burned, and Confused.

attacks.name: Sinister Alert
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent’s Pokemon.

attacks.name: Dirty Throw
attacks.text: Discard 1 card from your hand. If you can’t discard a card, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Bag Cut
attacks.text: Look at your opponent’s hand and discard 1 Item card that you find there.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokemon can’t retreat during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: This Pokemon can’t use this attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Mountain Munch
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent’s deck.

attacks.name: Red Viking
attacks.text: If your opponent’s Active Pokemon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Brutal Edge
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent’s Active Pokemon.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Lariat
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

ability.name: Carry Run
ability.text: As long as this Pokemon is on your Bench, your Active Pokemon’s Retreat Cost is [C][C] less.

name: Energy Retrieval
text: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Energy Switch
text: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokemon to another of your Pokemon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Great Catcher
text: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can’t discard 2 cards, you can’t play this card.)
Switch 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokemon-GX or Pokemon-EX with their Active Pokemon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Switch
text: Switch your opponent with another player.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Pokemon Communication
text: Reveal a Pokemon from your hand and put it into your deck. If you do, search your deck for a Pokemon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Janine
text: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and put 2 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Professor Oak’s Setting
text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokemon of different types and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Judge
text: Each player shuffles their hand into their deck and draws 4 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Rollerskater
text: Discard a card from your hand. Then, draw 2 cards. If you discarded an Energy card, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Weakguard Energy
text: This card provides 1 [C] Energy.
The Pokemon this card is attached to has no Weakness.

name: Draw Energy
text: This card provides [C] Energy.
When you attach this card from your hand to a Pokemon, you may draw a card.

name: Acrobike
text: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Discard the other card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Escape Board
text: The Retreat Cost of the Pokemon this card is attached to is [C] less, and it can retreat even if it’s Asleep or Paralyzed.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Lady
text: Search your deck for up to 4 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Welder
text: Attach up to 2 [R] Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Pokemon. If you do, draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokemon.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Vileplume-GX
text: When your Pokemon-GX is Knocked Our, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Big Bloom
attacks.text: 180- damage. This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokemon.

attacks.name: Allergy Bomb GX
attacks.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Poisoned, Burned, and Paralyzed. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

ability.name: Fragrant Flower Garden
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from each of your Pokemon.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Stomp Off
attacks.text: Discard 2 cards from the top of your opponent’s deck.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon.

attacks.name: Fire Fling
attacks.text: Put 4 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon. Then, discard an Energy from your opponent’s Active Pokemon.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Bubble Hold
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokemon is a Basic Pokemon, it can’t attack during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Direct Dive
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokemon and do 100 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokemon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attacks.name: Recall
attacks.text: Choose an attack from this Pokemon’s previous Evolutions and use it as this attack.

attacks.name: Aqua Fall
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokemon.

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

ability.name: Disperse
ability.text: If this Pokemon has any damage counters on it, flip a coin at the end of your opponent’s turn. If tails, shuffle this Pokemon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

attacks.name: Liquidation
attacks.text: During your next turn, any damage done to the Defending Pokemon by attacks is increased by 60.

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Volt Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokemon does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Powerful Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Lightning Energy attached to your Pokemon.

attacks.name: Mirror Shot
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent’s next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

ability.name: Beacon
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose up to 3 Supporter cards from your deck, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. This Pokemon is now Knocked Out.

name: Solgaleo & Lunala-GX
text: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cosmic Burn
attacks.text: This Pokemon can’t use Cosmic Burn during your next turn.

attacks.name: Light of the Goddess
attacks.text: If you played “Lillie’s Best Effort” from your hand during this turn, during your opponent’s next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to each of your Pokemon. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.

ability.name: Blast Bomb
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokemon is discarded by the effect of “Roxie,” you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent’s Pokemon. (Resolve Roxie’s effect first.)

attacks.name: Balloon Burst
attacks.text: Discard this Pokemon and all cards attached to it.

ability.name: Blast Bomb
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokemon is discarded by the effect of “Roxie,” you may  put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent’s Pokemon. (Resolve Roxie’s effect first.)

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards from either player’s deck and return them to the top of that deck in any order.

attacks.name: Ominous Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Life Drain
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on your opponent’s Active Pokemon until its remaining HP is 10.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokemon to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

ability.name: Double Type
ability.text: As long as this Pokemon is in play, its type is both [P] and [F].

attacks.name: Impersonate
attacks.text: Discard a Supporter card from your hand. Then, use the effect of that Supporter as an effect of this attack.

attacks.name: Mischievous Hands
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counter on 2 of your opponent’s Pokemon each.

attacks.name: Dig Deep
attacks.text: Put an Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Tail Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Rototiller
attacks.text: Shuffle a card from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Eleventh Hour Tackle
attacks.text: If you have 3 or fewer cards in your deck, this attack does 150 more damage.

attacks.name: Drill Bazooka
attacks.text: Discard 4 cards from the top of your deck.

attacks.name: Mini Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokemon (don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon).

attacks.name: Tremor Fist
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your Benched Pokemon with any damage counters on them.

ability.name: Smooth Over
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a card, shuffle your deck, and then put that card on top of it.

attacks.name: Thwomp Fall
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Pokemon from your hand that have a Retreat Cost of 4. This attack does 50 damage for each card discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 100 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Doll Transformation
attacks.text: Return this Pokemon and all cards attached to it into your hand. Then, you may play a Lillie’s Clefairy Doll from your hand as your Active Pokemon.

name: Reshiram & Zekrom-GX
text: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Thunderflame Dream
attacks.text: Discard up to 3 in any combination of basic [R] and basic [L] Energy cards from your Benched Pokemon. This attack does 90 damage for each card discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Cross Break GX
attacks.text: This attack does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokemon. If you played “N’s Resolve” from your hand during this turn, this attack also does 170 damage to another 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokemon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Baby-Doll Eyes
attacks.text: The Defending Pokemon can’t retreat during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Work Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokemon’s attacks do 60 more damage to your opponent’s Active Pokemon.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokemon (don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon).

ability.name: Fierce Bark
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you play this card from your hand to evolve a Pokemon, you may discard an Energy from your opponent’s Active Pokemon. If this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent’s attack, you may discard an Energy from your opponent’s Active Pokemon.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Silvally-GX
text: When your Pokemon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Buddy Brave
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during your turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: White Knight GX
attacks.text: If your opponent’s Active Pokemon is an Ultra Beast, that Pokemon is Knocked Out. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

ability.name: Disc Reload
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards from your deck until you have 5 cards in your hand.

name: Lana’s Fishing Rod
text: Shuffle 1 Pokemon and 1 Pokemon Tool from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Lillie’s Clefairy Doll
text: Play this card as if it were a 30 HP [C] Basic Pokemon.
At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may put this card on the bottom of your deck. (Discard all cards attached to it.)
This card can’t retreat. If this card is Knocked Out, your opponent can’t take any Prize cards for it.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Will
text: After playing this card, the first time you flip a coin for the effect of a Trainer card, an Ability, or an attack during this turn, you may choose to make the result heads or tails.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: N’s Resolve
text: Discard the top 6 cards from your deck. Attach all basic Energy discarded in this way to 1 of your Benched Dragon Pokemon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Roxie
text: Discard up to 2 Pokemon cards from your hand (excluding Pokemon-GX or EX). For each card you discarded, draw 3 cards from your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Rosa
text: You can play this card only if 1 of your Pokemon was Knocked Out during your opponent’s last turn.
Search your deck for a Pokemon, a Trainer, and a basic Energy, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Clay
text: Discard the top 7 cards of your deck. Reveal all Item cards discarded in this way to your opponent, and put them into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Lillie’s Best Effort
text: Draw 4 cards from your deck. If you have 3 or more cards in your hand at the end of this turn, shuffle cards into your deck until you have 2 cards remaining.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokemon.

attacks.name: Sun Power
attacks.text: During your next turn, ignore all Energy in the attack costs of each of your [G] and [R] Pokemon in play (including Pokemon put in play during that turn).

attacks.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Confused.

attacks.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Collect

If you have exactly 6 cards in your hand, this attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent’s Benched Pokemon (don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon).

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon during your opponent’s next turn.

ability.text: This Pokemon’s attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent’s Active Pokemon for each Prize card you have taken (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

text: When your Pokemon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

text: [.] Gnaw: 10 damage.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack’s damage isn’t affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Fist of Antiquity
attacks.text: If you have a Supporter card in your discard pile, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Poison Culture
attacks.text: If your opponent’s Active Pokémon is Poisoned, put 10 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

name: Oriocorio-GX
text: When your Pokemon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

ability.name: Dedicated Dance
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if 1 of your Pokemon was Knocked Out during your opponent’s last turn, you may draw 3 cards. You can’t use more than 1 Dedicated Dance Ability per turn.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokemon and play it on this Pokemon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

ability.name: Unaware
ability.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent’s Pokemon’s attacks done to this Pokemon.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: During your opponent’s next turn, any damage done to this Pokemon by your opponent’s Pokemon’s attacks is reduced by 40 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

ability.name: Lunar Ring
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Solgaleo in play, you may search your deck for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to your Solgaleo and Lunala in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Attract
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokemon and switch it with their Active Pokemon.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokemon can’t use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

attacks.name: Nest Building
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it in your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon during your opponent’s next turn.

name: Vibrava
text: – Fighting –
Stage 1 – Evolves from Trapinch

ability.name: Annoying Buzz
ability.text: When your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokemon.

name: Flygon-GX
text: When your Pokemon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Desert Hurricane
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 120 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Sonic Edge GX
attacks.text: This attack’s damage isn’t affected by any effects on your opponent’s Active Pokemon. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

ability.name: Sandstorm Protection
ability.text: As long as this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, any damage done to your Pokemon from your opponent’s attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Anorith
text: – Fighting –
Stage 1 – Evolves from Unidentified Fossil

attacks.name: Ancient Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Unidentified Fossil in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Mach Claw
attacks.text: This attack’s damage isn’t affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Switch your opponent’s Active Pokemon with 1 of their Benched Pokemon. (Your opponent chooses the Benched Pokemon to switch.)

attacks.name: Voltage Claw
attacks.text: If your opponent’s Active Pokemon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

ability.name: Boiling Blood
ability.text: If your opponent has any Pokemon-GX in play, the Energy cost for this Pokemon’s attack is reduced by [C][C][C].

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent’s hand. Your opponent reveals that card, then shuffles it into their deck.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent’s next turn, any damage done to this Pokemon by attacks is reduced by 20.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your Pokemon (don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon).

name: Alolan Sandshrew
text: [.] Run Around: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Alolan Sandslash
text: [.] Round Attack: 30 damage. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokemon by attacks during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Enhanced Needle
attacks.text: If this Pokemon has a Pokemon Tool attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Dual Call
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 TAG TEAM cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Dark Clamp
attacks.text: The Defending Pokemon can’t retreat during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Hard Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin, if heads the opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Triple Nose
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins, this attack does an additional 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Solar Fang
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokemon.

ability.name: Sunne Armor
ability.text: If you have Lunala in play, all of your Solgaleo and Lunala in play take 50 less damage from your opponent’s attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can’t apply more than 1 Sunne Armor Ability at a time.

name: Alolan Ninetales
text: [.] Dust Blow: 10x damage. This attack does 10 damage for each Pokemon Tool card in your discard pile.

ability.name: Rapid Charge
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokemon. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

attacks.name: Flower Invitation
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 [Y] Pokemon, reveal them, and put them in your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Petal Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent’s Pokemon (don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon).

ability.name: Flower Picking
ability.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may choose a card in your opponent’s hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads. This Pokemon is now Confused.

ability.name: Flower Picking
ability.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may choose 2 cards in your opponent’s hand. Your opponent reveals those cards and shuffles them into their deck.

name: Swirlix
text: Basic Pokemon

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent’s next turn, any damage done to this Pokemon by attacks is reduced by 10.

attacks.name: Charming Aroma
attacks.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sweet Panic
attacks.text: If your opponent’s Active Pokemon isn’t Confused, this attack fails.

attacks.name: Moonblast
attacks.text: During your opponent’s next turn, the Defending Pokemon’s attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Love Wave
attacks.text: If you played a TAG TEAM Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Arceus & Dialga & Palkia-GX
text: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ultimate Ray
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokemon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Altered Creation GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your Pokemon attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent’s Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra [W] Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack’s cost), when your opponent’s Active Pokemon is Knocked Out by damage from those attacks, take 1 more Prize card. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Naganadel & Guzzlord-GX
text: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Chaos Order GX
attacks.text: Flip over your Prize cards (they remain face-up for the rest of the game). If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra [P] and 1 extra [D] attached to it (in addition to this attack’s cost), take 2 Prize cards. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

ability.name: Gluttony
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Pokemon from your hand. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokemon.

attacks.name: Dragon Fan
attacks.text: If this Pokemon has at least 2 different types of basic Energy attached to it, this does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Raging Claws
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokemon.

ability.name: Warrior’s Roar
ability.text: If your opponent has any Pokemon-GX or Pokemon-EX in play, this Pokemon can evolve on the turn that it comes into play.

attacks.name: Shout of Power
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

attacks.name: Scale Uppercut
attacks.text: You may discard a Pokemon Tool from this Pokemon. If you do, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Destruction Shine
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent’s Active Pokemon.

ability.name: Ultra Burst
ability.text: This Pokemon can only attack if your opponent has 2 or fewer Prize cards remaining.

name: Mega Lopunny & Jigglypuff-GX
text: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jumping Balloon
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each of your opponent’s Pokemon-EX and Pokemon-GX.

attacks.name: Puff Smasher GX
attacks.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokemon is now Asleep. If this Pokemon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack’s cost), this attack does 200 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokemon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it in your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

ability.name: Darting Tail
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put the top card of your opponent’s deck on the bottom of their deck (without looking).

attacks.name: Come-Come Catch
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Bye-Bye Throw
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 cards from your hand. This attack does 60 damage for each card discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Heavy Hold
attacks.text: The Defending Pokemon can’t attack during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage or each heads.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokemon can’t retreat during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Aero Fall
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokemon.

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can’t attack during your opponent’s next turn.

attacks.name: Parabola Counter
attacks.text: If your opponent has any [L] Pokemon in play, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Tag Whistle
text: Search your deck for up to 2 TAG TEAM cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Unidentified Fossil
text: Play this card as if it were a 60 HP [C] Basic Pokemon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may discard this card from play.
This card can’t retreat.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Island Challenge Amulet
text: Pokemon Tool: Attach a Pokemon Tool to 1 of your Pokemon that doesn’t already have a Pokemon Tool attached to it.

The max HP of the Pokemon-GX or Pokemon-EX this card is attached to is reduced by 100. If this Pokemon is Knocked Out by damage from the attacks of your opponent’s Pokemon, they take 1 less Prize card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Beastite
text: Pokemon Tool: Attach a Pokemon Tool to 1 of your Pokemon that doesn’t already have a Pokemon Tool attached to it.
The attacks of the Ultra Beast this card is attached to do 10 more damage for each Prize card you’ve taken to your opponent’s Active Pokemon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Guzma & Hala
text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
When you play this card, you may discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, you may also search your deck for a Pokemon Tool and Special Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Cynthia & Caitlin
text: Put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand (excluding any Cynthia & Caitlin or cards discarded by this card).
When you play this card, you may discard 1 card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Mallow & Lana
text: Switch your Active Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.
When you play this card, you may discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, heal 120 damage from the new Active Pokemon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Red & Blue
text: Search your deck for a Pokemon-GX that evolves from 1 of your Pokemon in play and put it on that Pokemon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can’t use this card during your first turn or on a Pokemon that was put into play this turn.)
When you play this card, you may discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to the Pokemon you evolved.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Chaotic Swell
text: When either player plays a new Stadium card from their hand to discard this Stadium card, discard the new Stadium card as well. (Ignore all effects from the new Stadium card.)
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can’t play this card.

name: Cherish Ball
text: Search your deck for a Pokemon-GX, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Adventure Bag
text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokemon Tool cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Pokemon Communication
text: Reveal a Pokemon from your hand and put it into your deck. If you do, search your deck for a Pokemon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Professor Elm’s Lecture
text: Search your deck for up to 3 Pokemon with 60 HP or less, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).
